TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void DesignerTransactionCloseEventHandler(object sender, DesignerTransactionCloseEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed DesignerTransactionCloseEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub DesignerTransactionCloseEventHandler(sender As Object, e As DesignerTransactionCloseEventArgs)
public delegate void DesignerTransactionCloseEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, DesignerTransactionCloseEventArgs ^ e);

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that handles the and events of a designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you create a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerTransactionCloseEventHandler> delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event-handler delegates, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
## Examples The following example demonstrates registering a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerTransactionCloseEventHandler> and handling the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost.TransactionClosing> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost.TransactionClosed> events.
